text: Emile William Ivanhoe Heskey (born 11 January 1978) is an English former footballer. At the pinnacle of his career, he played for Leicester City, Liverpool and Birmingham City. he later he played for Wigan Athletic and Aston Villa, then Newcastle Jets in the Australian A-League. For a while he was a regular member of the England national team, striking up a good partnership with fellow forward Michael Owen, where he was often deployed as a 'Target Man' due to his immense strength, good first touch and passing skills. == Career statistics == === Club === Club Season League FA Cup League Cup Europe Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Leicester City 1994–95 FA Premier League 1 0 0 0 0 0 — — 1 0 1995–96 First Division 30 7 0 0 2 0 — 3Appearances in First Division play-offs 0 35 7 1996–97 FA Premier League 35 10 3 0 9 2 — — 47 12 1997–98 FA Premier League 35 10 2 0 0 0 2Appearances in UEFA Cup 0 — 39 10 1998–99 FA Premier League 30 6 2 0 8 3 — — 40 9 1999–2000 FA Premier League 23 7 4 0 8 1 — — 35 8 Total 154 40 11 0 27 6 2 0 3 0 197 46 Liverpool 1999–2000 FA Premier League 12 3 0 0 0 0 — — 12 3 2000–01 FA Premier League 36 14 5 5 4 0 11 3 — 56 22 2001–02 FA Premier League 35 9 2 0 1 0 1716 appearances in UEFA Champions League, 1 in UEFA Super Cup 5 1Appearance in FA Charity Shield 0 56 14 2002–03 FA Premier League 32 6 3 0 5 0 116 appearances in UEFA Champions League, 5 in UEFA Cup 3 1 0 52 9 2003–04 FA Premier League 35 7 4 1 2 2 6 2 — 47 12 Total 150 39 14 6 12 2 45 13 2 0 223 60 Birmingham City 2004–05 FA Premier League 34 10 2 1 2 0 — — 38 11 2005–06 FA Premier League 34 4 3 0 3 1 — — 40 5 Total 68 14 5 1 5 1 — — 78 16 Wigan Athletic 2006–07 FA Premier League 34 8 1 0 1 0 — — 36 8 2007–08 Premier League 28 4 2 0 0 0 — — 30 4 2008–09 Premier League 20 3 0 0 2 0 — — 22 3 Total 82 15 3 0 3 0 — — 88 15 Aston Villa 2008–09 Premier League 14 2 0 0 0 0 0 0 — 14 2 2009–10 Premier League 31 3 4 0 5 2 2Appearances in UEFA Europa League 0 — 42 5 2010–11 Premier League 19 3 2 0 2 2 2 1 — 25 6 2011–12 The 2011–12 season accessed via dropdown menu.
